CatDescriptText: Gibson played for the Homestead Grays (1929-'31, '37-'40, '42-'46), the Pittsburgh Crawfords ('32-'36),  Santo Domingo ('37), and the Mexican League ('40-'41).  He was born in 1911 and died at the age of 35 in 1947.  In 1972 he was the second Negro League player to be elected into the Baseball Hall of Fame.
TitMainTitle: Baseball player, possibly from Pittsburgh Crawfords team, wearing catcher's gear, rising from crouch and tossing mask in air, at home plate at Forbes Field
